dataset.title: Total numbers and species of insects taken from the Oksrukuyuk Creek rock scrubbings during the summer of 1990 , Arctic LTER 1990.

abstract.para: Total numbers and species of insects taken from the Oksrukuyuk Creek rock scrubbings during the summer of 1990

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications

A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:
Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Just a kilometer or two upstream of where the Oksrukuyuk Creek crosses the Dalton highway, approximately 15 miles south of the Sag River DOT station.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: Jul 91 DATA FILE ENTERED BY:Julie Pallant DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Julie Pallant DATE: 1 oct 91

para.literalLayout: A rock-scrubbing technique was used to collect bottom samples at ten different stations (-737m, -550m, -320m, -267m, -136m, 233m, 482m, 1056m, 1370m, and 1800m) with two replicates at each station in the Oksrukuyuk Creek. Five different dates were sampled, the same procedure was used for every date. The stations are measured relative to the future site of the new dripper. The samples were preserved in ethanol then picked, sorted, counted, and measured in Duluth using a digitizing pad.
Notes: There is one sample missing from the worksheet: -550m #1, 30-July-1990. *** All insect numbers are counts of larval forms. ***

Variable descrip. Precis./Units Coded Missing (Y/N) Values SITE Oksrukuyuk Creek y DATE date DDMMMYY n STATION distance from new dripper meters n TRIAL repetition number 1 or 2 n RHYACOPH number of rhyacophila n blank BRACHY number of brachycentrus n blank BRA PUPA number of brachy pupae n blank ORTHOCLAD number of orthocladius n blank NATARSIA number of natarsia n blank CHIRON number of chironomids n blank CHIR PUPA number of chironomid pupae n blank BAETIS number of baetis n blank BAE SP3 number of baetis "species 3" n blank CINYGM number of cinygmula n blank NEMOURA number of nemoura n blank SB FLY number of small black flies n blank LB FLY number of large black flies n blank BF PUPA number of black fly pupae n blank COMMENTS notes about data n blank (12) CALCULATIONS Variable Formula
